en-US.alert_about: Create, manage, and view the shortcuts that will run automatically in the background via Autocuts as you use your iOS device.
en-US.alert_donate: Thank you for donating and supporting my development of shortcuts like Autocuts!
en-US.alert_help_advanced:
Visit Autocuts Admin's Settings page for additional options for controlling Autocuts.

• Verify Shortcuts: When checked, Autocuts Admin will generate a list of shortcuts that Autocuts will match against when running. If a shortcut does not exist, it will not run.

• Log Activity: Autocuts will write a log file of its activity on iCloud Drive > Shortcuts > Autocuts > log-{devicename}.txt.

• Notify After Evaluation: When run, Autocuts will notify you of the Autocuts it ran, skipped, or removed.
en-US.alert_help_autocut:
An Autocut is a text file stored on iCloud Drive or Dropbox that instructs Autocuts to run a shortcut automatically while you use your iOS device during the day. Each Autocut has the following properties:

• shortcut: the shortcut to run.

• date: the date and time that an Autocut can first be run.

• expires: the amount of time in minutes after the scheduled date that an Autocut can still be run. Shortcuts of expired Autocuts will not run. Autocuts can also be set to never expire.

• device: the name of the iOS device that can run this Autocut. Leave blank to run the Autocut on any device. 

• activate: set to true to open the Shortcuts app before running the Autocut's shortcut. Used for those shortcuts that do not run properly in the background.

• input: text input that will be sent to an Autocut's shortcut when run.
en-US.alert_help_creating:
Autocuts can be created in a number of ways. Any shortcut or application that can write to the Shortcuts folder on iCloud Drive or a Dropbox folder can create an Autocut.

Some examples include:

• Autocuts Admin: the shortcut you are using now features an assistant that walks tou step-by-step in creating an Autocut.

• API: Send the Autocuts Admin a specially-formatted dictionary to create and schedule Autocuts from a third-party shortcut.

• IFTTT or Zapier: any trigger can write an Autocut text file to an Autocuts Dropbox source folder.
en-US.alert_help_destinations:
Destination services deliver Autocuts to local and remote sources. Autocuts Admin supports the following destination services:

• iCloud Drive: a folder within the Shortcuts folder on iCloud Drive. Make sure to add this folder path as a source if you want Autocuts on this device to process them.

• Dropbox: A folder on Dropbox where to store your Autocut files. Make sure to add this folder path as a source if you want Autocuts on this device to process them.

• IFTTT: Requires a Maker Webhooks Event name and API key to send a webhook to IFTTT which should create an Autocut file on Dropbox.

• Zapier: Requires catch hook URL to send an Autocut to Zapier. The Zap should then create the Autocut file on Dropbox.

For the IFTTT and Zapier, read the full documentation on how to configure and use these services.
en-US.alert_help_repeatInterval:
By default, the Open App personal automation will cause Autocuts to run every time you open one of the selected apps.

Repeat Interval allows you to control the frequency at which Autocuts will perform its evaluation.

For example, you can configure Autocuts to run every minute, five minutes, thirty minutes, or hour.

During the in-between evaluation periods, Autocuts will exit much more quickly when run from an Open App personal automation.
en-US.alert_help_setup1:
In order to run shortcuts automatically in the background, you need to have the Autocuts shortcut installed.

With Autocuts Admin, you can create, manage, and view all shortcuts that are scheduled to run automatically as you use your iOS device throughout the day.

Tap Install Autocuts from the Autocuts Admin Home screen to get the latest version of Autocuts.
en-US.alert_help_setup2:
To run your shortcuts automatically, Autocuts must be configured to run each time you open your most commonly used apps.

1. Tap Automation in Shortcuts.

2. Tap the + button.

3. Tap Create Personal Automation.

4. Choose Open App.

5. Select the apps you use often and tap Done.
en-US.alert_help_setup3:
6. Tap Next.

7. Tap Add Action.

8. Add a Run Shortcut action and set it to Autocuts.

9. Tap Show More and disable Show While Running.

10. Tap Next and disable Ask Before Running.

11. Tap Done.
en-US.alert_help_setup4:
Now, whenever you open one of your selected apps, Autocuts will run in the background.

Autocuts created by Autocuts Admin or a Destination Service will be processed and their shortcuts run.

You can limit how often Autocuts performs its evaluation by installing LimitKit and configuring Autocut's LimitKit Interval in Settings.
en-US.alert_help_sources:
Autocut Sources are folders on iCloud Drive or Dropbox that hold your Autocut files. 

When you add a source to Autocuts using Autocuts Admin, any file whose filename begins with "Autocut" or "autocut" will be processed whenever Autocuts runs. 

If an Autocut file is valid for the current time and has not expired, the shortcut specified in the Autocut will run. 

ADVANCED
Setting up shared Dropbox folders as Autocut sources will allow shortcuts to run automatically on remote iOS devices as their owners use them throughout the day.
en-US.alert_help_troubleshooting:
Shortcut automation in iOS is a new and evolving technology. You may encounter the following issues when using Autocuts.

• XPC connection to the extension was interrupted: It could be a temporary error on the part of iOS or one of the shortcuts you are trying to run may have experienced an error.

• Your shortcuts do not run. Turn on Use Logs and Notify Activity in Autocuts Admin Settings to see exactly what's happening when Autocuts runs. Run Autocuts from the Shortcuts app and from an Open App automation to see if there's a reproducible difference.

• You are offline: Autocuts does not evaluate Dropbox sources if you are not connected to the internet.

Read the full documentation for more troubleshooting tips and tricks.
en-US.alert_install: Download the latest version of the Autocuts shortcut. This is required to run your shortcuts automatically in the background as you use your iOS device.
en-US.alert_localization:
Want to see Autocuts localized for your native language?

Visit Autocut Admin's localization page on GitHub and submit a pull request.
en-US.alert_reminders: Run Autocuts to run scheduled shortcuts.
en-US.alert_reminders_note: An Autocuts shortcut was originally set to run now. Launch Autocuts manually or by opening one of its Open App personal automation apps to run any scheduled background shortcuts.
en-US.alert_schedule: The Autocut running the shortcut '{{shortcut}}' was scheduled using the {{service}} destination service.
en-US.alert_source_shortcutsNone: There are no allowed shortcuts defined for this source.
en-US.alert_update_autocuts: Please install the latest version of Autocuts for complete compatibility with this version of Autocuts Admin.
en-US.alert_update_none: You are running the latest version of Autocuts Admin.
en-US.alert_welcome:
Autocuts automatically runs shortcuts in the background while you use your iOS device.

Configure how Autocuts operates using the Autocuts Admin shortcut.
en-US.error_autocut_invalid: This file is not a valid Autocut.
en-US.error_autocut_notFound: The Autocut could not be found.
en-US.error_autocut_save: An error occurred while trying to save the Autocut file.
en-US.error_functionStack_empty: No function was defined. Defaulting to
en-US.error_offline: You must be connected to the internet to perform this action.
en-US.error_service_deleteDefault: You cannot delete the default Dropbox destination service.
en-US.error_service_name: A service name cannot be blank.
en-US.error_service_zapierURL: A Zapier Custom Webhook URL must begin with https://hooks.zapier.com/hooks/catch/
en-US.error_services_none: No destination services could be found to deliver this Autocut.
en-US.error_source_defaultDelete: The default source cannot be deleted.
en-US.error_source_name: The source name cannot be empty
en-US.label_notify_middle_description: Only if there are shortcuts to run
en-US.label_notify_intervalReminder_descriptio: Tap notification link to run manually
en-US.label_source_shortcutsAll: All shortcuts can run from this source.
en-US.menu_settings_openShortcuts_description: Best used when Run Interval enabled
en-US.name: English
en-US.prompt_activeTime: Will this Autocut run during a specific time range or any time?
en-US.prompt_activeTime_start:
Set the start time for this Autocut.

The shortcut will only run between this time and the end time.
en-US.prompt_activeTime_end:
Set the end time for this Autocut.

The shortcut will only run between {{time}} and before this time.
en-US.prompt_activeDays: Select the days you want the Autocut to run:
en-US.prompt_autocut_service:
Select the destination for this Autocut.

Choosing a remote destination allows you to run shortcuts automatically on other devices that use Autocuts.
en-US.prompt_autocut_typeSchedule: Select the schedule by which your Autocut will run:
en-US.prompt_delete: Delete this Autocut? This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_delete_multiple: Delete the selected Autocuts? This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_donate:
Have you been enjoying how Autocuts has enabled you to run your shortcuts automatically in the background while you use your iOS device throughout the day?

If so, consider sending me a tip as a token of appreciation!
en-US.prompt_erase_content:
Are you sure you want to delete all Autocuts content and settings for this device?

Note: Autocut files in source directories will not be deleted, but references to your source folders will be removed.

This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_erase_content2:
Are you ABSOLUTELY SURE you want to delete all Autocuts  content and settings for this device?

Note: Autocut files in source directories will not be deleted, but references to your source folders will be removed.

This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_expiration_custom:
Enter the number of minutes after the scheduled date that the Autocut will be active.

The Autocut will not run past its expiration date.
en-US.prompt_filter: Separate keywords with newlines to filter the list of Autocuts.
en-US.prompt_input: Choose data to send to the shortcut when run.
en-US.prompt_input_askShortcut: Autocuts will call {{shortcut}} with "Autocuts Custom Input". Confirm that the shortcut will display custom UI for providing input for this Autocut.
en-US.prompt_input_date: Enter a date that will be sent to the shortcut when it runs.
en-US.prompt_input_datetime: Enter a date and time that will be sent to the shortcut when it runs
en-US.prompt_input_location: Enter an address that will be sent to the shortcut when it runs
en-US.prompt_input_number: Enter a number that will be sent to the shortcut when it runs
en-US.prompt_input_text: Enter text that will be sent to the shortcut. Use tokens {{location}}, {{location_weather}}, {{datetime}}, {{date}}, and {{time}} to insert the current location, weather location, etc. into the Autocut
en-US.prompt_input_time: Enter a time that will be sent to the shortcut when it runs.
en-US.prompt_autocuts_repeatInterval: Enter the number of minutes to wait before Autocuts can run again:
en-US.prompt_repeatInterval:
Set the Repeat Interval for this Autocut.

After running, an Autocut will wait the selected amount of time before its shortcut can run again.
en-US.prompt_repeatInterval_custom:
Repeat Interval

The Repeat Interval controls how often an Autocut's shortcut will run.

You will choose the unit of measurement (seconds, minutes, hours, etc.) in the next screen.

Enter 0 to run the Autocut's shortcut each time during its active time range.
en-US.prompt_repeatInterval_unit: Select the unit of measurement that Autocuts will wait before running the shortcut again.
en-US.prompt_list: Displaying Autocuts in all of your source folders.
en-US.prompt_name: Enter a descriptive name for your Autocut:
en-US.prompt_notify: Select the notifications you wish to receive during Autocuts evaluation process
en-US.prompt_onSuccess: What should happen to the Autocut after a successful run?
en-US.prompt_option_continueInShortcuts:
Run the shortcut in the background or open the Shortcuts app before running?

NOTE: Some shortcuts require the Shortcuts app to be the active application in order to run properly.
en-US.prompt_option_device: Run this Autocut on this device, all devices, or a specific device?
en-US.prompt_option_deviceName:
Enter the name of the iOS device on which this Autocut will run.

You can find the device name in Settings > General > About > Name
en-US.prompt_option_expiration:
Set the default expiration period.

Expired Autocuts will not run their shortcuts and will be deleted by Autocuts.
en-US.prompt_option_date: When do you want this Autocut to become available for running?
en-US.prompt_option_scheduleCustom: Choose a custom date for your Autocut?
en-US.prompt_path: Path where Autocut entries are located.
en-US.prompt_reminder: Create a reminder to run Autocuts for this shortcut on {{datetime}}?
en-US.prompt_reset: Reset Autocuts settings or erase all content and settings for Autocuts?
en-US.prompt_reset_settings:
Are you sure you want to reset Autocuts settings on this device?

None of your content will be affected.
en-US.prompt_service_delete: Delete this service? This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_service_dropbox: Enter the path to the folder on Dropbox where Autocuts will be saved using this destination service:
en-US.prompt_service_dropbox_details: Using this destination service will place Autocuts in the following folder on Dropbox:
en-US.prompt_service_icloud: Enter the iCloud Drive folder path (relative to the Shortcuts folder):
en-US.prompt_service_icloud_details: Autocuts will be sent to the following iCloud Drive folder:

en-US.prompt_service_ifttt_event: Enter the event name for the IFTTT Webhook:
en-US.prompt_service_name: Enter a name for this service
en-US.prompt_service_new:
Select the type of Autocut Destination Service to create.

• iCloud Drive: Creates Autocuts in iCloud Drive local to this iOS device.

• Dropbox: Creates Autocuts in Dropbox folders local to this iOS device.

• IFTTT and Zapier: Calls the webhook triggers of these two services to write to remote Dropbox folders.
en-US.prompt_service_zapier: Enter the Zapier Custom Webhook URL:
en-US.prompt_service_zapier_details: Autocuts will be sent to the following Zapier webhook:
en-US.prompt_services: Autocut Destinations allow you to create Autocuts locally or on remote iOS devices.
en-US.prompt_shortcut_change: This Autocut already has a defined shortcut. Are you sure you want to change the shortcut?
en-US.prompt_source_delete: Delete this source? None of the files stored on iCloud Drive or Dropbox will be affected. This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_source_name: Enter a descriptive name for this source
en-US.prompt_source_path: Enter the path to the Autocuts source folder on this service:
en-US.prompt_source_shortcuts: Should Autocuts in this source be allowed to run any shortcut on this device or select ones?
en-US.prompt_source_shortcutsChoose: Select the shortcuts that Autocuts in this source can run:
en-US.prompt_source_shortcutsRemove: Select shortcuts to remove from the list of allowed shortcuts.
en-US.prompt_source_type: Select a source for your Autocuts:
en-US.prompt_sources:
Sources are folders on iCloud Drive or Dropbox where your Autocuts are located.

Autocuts can be placed in sources locally using Autocuts Admin or remotely with services like IFTTT and Zapier.
